Syndra's nerf was removed from patch 6.24 because her win rate, ban rate and pick rate all dropped more than we expected. Balance isn't decided by those stats by itself of course, they're a particularly useful guide when it comes to understanding urgency of problems though. 

When we pulled the nerf we were originally thinking we'd wait and see whether we should add it to 7.1 (the next patch) instead. Current thinking is that we can instead use that extra time to explore better changes than just a base damage nerf (removes some power, but doesn't by itself address underlying problems enough)

The MYMU created a lot of problems with the Mages in general, Syndra being one of them, so do you guys have any plans to go back and look at what went wrong with some of those updates? I feel like on a lot of the changes made, you guys were sort of at odds with the community where it was almost like our input was being ignored. Well regardless of whether you do a MYMU second update I would definitely like for you guys to take another crack at Malzahar...
Please, please look at her W passive. Both Syndra players and those playing against her hate brainless 7 Ball ults, changing anything else would be a travesty.

We're looking at it. Can't make any promises about what we will/won't change though until we've both given her a decent assessment and tested out changes based on that though. Very much a work in progress right now.

Thank you. Anything that gets rid of constant, effortless multiple sphere uptime would make me and every other Syndra main very happy. Please make our champion take skill to play again, both for our sake (I want to do something worth being rewarded for!) and the sake of those playing against Syndra.

I've been musing on ways to keep the multi-throw passive mechanic for W, and I keep running into the problems where the gravity of its presence means other parts have to change. Her ultimate, for instance, would have to get slowed down from a 9-12 second charge rate (0% cdr), to something like a 16-20 second. But this has an impact in that it takes her nearly twice as long to have a 'usable ultimate', and most everything in the game will kill her within 5 seconds. So, usability goes way down, and more emphasis is on leaning her regular Q/W/E abilities ... but they're not really made with the mind of keeping her up and going for a nearly 20 second period.

Plus, there's the implication her Q's CD increases, so her overall applicable damage and sphere generation will slow as a result. This means there's more emphasis on the W to grab and position spheres ... and makes her even slower when dealing with the breakneck speed mobility that comes after her, typically. Edit: the flipside to this would be to increase the overall spheres required on the ultimate, which would keep Q static. However, that creates even more visual clutter with all her extra spheres on the field.

I can keep going with theory, but the net result is that it seems to snowball into a bigger problem that wants the rest of her changed to allow it to exist. So, that's what I'm seeing, not sure if you guys are.

[But nerf AP Kog in preseason instead even though Rylai's is getting nerfed, Blue is getting nerfed and assassins aren't performing well?](http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/champions-gameplay-feedback/GiT6sELL-kogs-e-ap-ratio-nerf-is-a-double-whammy) It's amazing how careful you guys are about potentially overnerfing Syndra, a champion which has dominated Worlds and snuffed out midlane champion choices for months but in the same breath suggesting nerfs for a champion which has neither her banrate, her dominance, her playrate or her obnoxious no counterplay stun -> 1-shot kit (or just stun and run if in trouble). If anything, Syndra is stronger now than ever before because there is no Strength of the Ages to reduces her burst, Bounty Hunter and Double Edged Sword were both buffed and the Locket Aura was removed. People just don't take preseason seriously enough to play their very best champions.

I want to trust Riot's balance but then you guys make ridiculous decisions like this based on meaningless samples in preseason without even intelligently factoring in context. Winrate should be a minor factor in strength evaluation unless it's for high ELO (Diamond+) and experienced players (50+ games with a champion). You're just going to see Syndra pick/ban in every LCS game again soon and in a month you'll be back to 6.18 status. 

It feels like Riot just decides who they want to exist in a good state and who should be at best a barely viable punching bag. It seems like Riot is playing favorites for what styles/champions are allowed to be strong and that champions are not nerfed or buffed on merit. Then we hear talk about wanting strategic diversity and it just seems so empty. That's the definition of defining the meta and I've seen way too many situations with strong champions merely rotated out for a new set rather than objective balance with the goal of just having a fair game for everyone. 

Reevaluating Syndra wouldn't seem so hypocritical to me if the same approach was taken with Kog but nope, he's just instantly nerfed based on a better than average preseason performance (not even anything special looking at worldwide stats. and especially considering the indirect nerfs coming in 6.24). What's next, is Ziggs going to get nerfed too because he's performing better than before even if he's still shit in Masters+ when facing actually good mids like Ahri, LB or a skilled Viktor? 

It's OK though, Ziggs will continue to be unviable in competitive as long as his laning has no kill pressure and his late game scaling is below that of many other choices with kill pressure in lane, such as Cassiopeia. However, I bet if we had even one patch of Ziggs being a good pick after years of gathering dust, he'd see instant nerfs just because Riot doesn't want his type of strategy to be successful regardless of whether or not there are good answers to it. Can you honestly say that if a champion like Xerath (and he even takes more skill to use properly) had Syndra's absurd dominance at every facet of play we'd still have this discussion?
